column3: Visual ACK\n
0.7, because it has to do with URIs ^^?\n

It has to do with URLs but not "URL stuff that scares Gavin".

And this fixes a crash bug reported on the forums? I guess it should go into 0.6.1 then...

This fixes a glitch with a payment request and the amount set, the crash observed in the forum was with 0.6 RC2 I can't reproduce this, but think as most changes here are very tiny it should go into 0.6.1.\n

From what I understand he performs a DOS attack on the QR generation code.
By pasting more and more text into the label field he eventually runs out
of memory or some other limit.

Maybe we should enforce a sanity limit on the URL length (256?) and above
that show an empty image.

I could be completely wrong.
An URI limit of <= 255 would be a good idea.\n
Added URI length limit and info message to prevent a DoS against the dialog window.\n

Works well. However, the info message is wider than the QR dialog, can you enable wordWrap on lblQRCode in the designer? Alternatively, paste this into the .ui file under <widget class="QLabel" name="lblQRCode">:

```
 <property name="wordWrap">
  <bool>true</bool>
 </property>
```
@laanwj Done!\n
Great, I intend to merge this asap, however seems sje397 and gavin's commit somehow ended up on this pull request? \n
ouch ... a rebase-mess sorry will cleanup ^^\n
fixed\n
Never mind: it already has deleteonclose in the constructor, this is OK, no memory leak happens.\n
Please don't use a magic string "(no label)" here. Why not simply use an empty string for "no label"?\n
These should be `index(...).data(Qt::EditRole)`. This will get the raw, unformatted data suitable for passing to other functions (and also get rid of "(no label)")\n
As both address and label are passed in, the code to construct the title could be moved to QRCodeDialog constructor\n
Good idea, will change this.\n
Right, didn't see this and Qt GUI stuff is still sometimes weird for me :D.\n
I changed this with the last commit, would be nice if you could take a look. That GUI stuff is pretty new for me.\n
There's no need to name "static" labels that will not accessed in the code, leaving them as label_X is fine... no need either to change it back though, it's fine.\n
I love speaking names ... that's kind of a fetish I have ;), sorry ^^.\n
